sen.j: 村上 専精（むらかみ せんしょう、嘉永4年4月1日 (旧暦)（1851年5月1日） - 昭和4年（1929年）10月31日）は、日本の明治・大正期に活躍した教育者、仏教史学者。
sen.e: Sensho MURAKAMI (May 1, 1851-October 31, 1929) was an educator and a scholar of Japanese Buddhistic history who played an active role from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.
Sensho MURAKAMI (May 1, 1851-October 31, 1929) was an educator and a scholar of Japanese Buddhistic history who played an active role from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.
Sensho MURAKAMI (May 1, 1851 - October 31, 1929) was an educator and a scholar of Japanese Buddhist history who played an active role from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。BuddhisticをBuddhistに訂正しました。

sen.j: 明治・大正期の教育界において主として高等教育の充実に尽力。
sen.e: He dedicated himself to enrich high education in the educational community from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.
He dedicated himself to enriching higher education in the educational community from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.
He dedicated himself to enriching higher education in the educational community from the Meiji period to the Taisho period.

sen.j: 特に、仏教思想・仏教史を近代的学問体系からの批判に耐え得る形で研究するとともに、その成果を自ら整備に関与した公私の諸教育機関において公開した。
sen.e: He researched Buddhistic concepts and history under the criticism from the modern academic system, and he disclosed his accomplishment in various public and private educational institutes in which he was involved when they were established.

He researched Buddhist concepts and history while coming under fire from the modern academic system, and he disclosed his accomplishments in various public and private educational institutes in which he was involved when they were established.

He researched Buddhist concepts and history while coming under fire from the modern academic system, and he disclosed his accomplishments in various public and private educational institutes in which he was involved when they were established.

sen.j: 丹波国の真宗大谷派教覚寺に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Shinshu sect Otani school Kyokaku-ji Temple.
He was born in Shinshu sect Otani school Kyokaku-ji Temple.
He was born in Shinshu sect Otani school Kyokaku-ji Temple in Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: in Tanba Province補足くしました。

sen.j: 本姓、広崎。
sen.e: His main name was Hirosaki.
sen.cmt: 広崎→Hirosaki としています。
sen.e: His main name was Hirosaki.
His main name was Hirosaki.

sen.j: 幼時より漢学の才にすぐれ苦学の後、姫路善教寺の天外、新潟県無為信寺の武田行忠等に師事。
sen.e: He had been excellent in Sinology since he was young; he became a disciple of Gyochu TAKEDA or other monks in Muishin-ji Temple in Niigata Prefecture, which was the furthest religion from Himeji Zenkyo-ji Temple, after he worked his way to study.
sen.cmt: 下記の文意が不明でしたが次のとおり訳出しました。姫路善教寺の天外→which was the furthest religion from Himeji Zenkyo-ji Temple
sen.e: He had been excellent in Sinology since he was young; he became a disciple of Gyochu TAKEDA or other monks in Muishin-ji Temple in Niigata Prefecture, which was the furthest religion from Himeji Zenkyo-ji Temple, after he worked his way to study.
sen.cmt: Robert: "after he worked his way to study." doesn't make sense
sen.e: He had been excellent in Sinology since he was young; he became a disciple of Gyochu TAKEDA or other monks in Muishin-ji Temple in Niigata Prefecture, which was the furthest religion from Himeji Zenkyo-ji Temple, after he worked his way to study.

sen.j: 1874年、京都府東本願寺の高倉学寮に入るがほどなく退寮。
sen.e: In 1874, he entered Takakura Gakuryo (the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary) of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in Kyoto, but soon left there.
In 1874, he entered Takakura Gakuryo (the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary) of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in Kyoto, but soon left there.
In 1874, he entered Takakura Gakuryo (the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary) of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple in Kyoto, but soon left there.

sen.j: 愛知県入覚寺の養子となり村上姓に改姓。
sen.e: He became the adopted child of Nyukaku-ji Temple in Aichi prefecture, and changed his name into MURAKAMI.
He became the adopted child of Nyukaku-ji Temple in Aichi prefecture, and changed his name into MURAKAMI.
He became the adopted child of Nyukaku-ji Temple in Aichi prefecture, and changed his name into Murakami.

sen.j: 1880年、再び京都に出て東本願寺の教師教校に入学、2年後には同寺の学階を得て真宗大学寮で講義を担当するに至った。
sen.e: In 1880, he came out to Kyoto again, and entered the teacher school of the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary, after two years, he took charge of lectures in Shinshu sect Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) after acquisition the academic rank of the temple.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明なため下記の用語を以下のとおり訳出しています。教師教校→teacher school真宗大学寮→Shinshu sect Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system)学階→academic rank
sen.e: In 1880, he came out to Kyoto again, and entered the school for teachers at the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary, after two years, he took charge of lectures in Shinshu sect Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) and acquired an academic rank within the temple.

In 1880, he came out to Kyoto again, and entered the school for teachers at the Higashi Hongan-ji seminary, after two years, he took charge of lectures in Shinshu sect Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) and acquired an academic rank within the temple.

sen.j: 1887年、東京の曹洞宗大学林（現、駒澤大学）に招聘されて講師に就任した。
sen.e: In 1887, he was invited by Sotoshu Daigakurin; Sotoshu University (present-day Komazawa University) and assumed the post as a lecturer.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1887, he was invited by Sotoshu Daigakurin; Sotoshu University (present-day Komazawa University) and assumed the post as a lecturer.
In 1887, he was invited by Sotoshu Daigakurin; Sotoshu University (present-day Komazawa University) and assumed the post as a lecturer.

sen.j: 同年、 井上円了が設立した哲学館(現、東洋大学)の講師を兼任した。
sen.e: In the same year, he assumed the additional post as a lecturer of Tetsugakukan; Private Academy of Philosophy (present-day Toyo University).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the same year, he assumed the additional post as a lecturer of Tetsugakukan; Private Academy of Philosophy (present-day Toyo University).
In the same year, he assumed the additional post as a lecturer of Tetsugakukan; Private Academy of Philosophy (present-day Toyo University).

sen.j: 翌年、東京帝国大学文科大学のインド哲学の講師となり、1905年、東洋高等女学校(現、東洋女子高等学校)を創設した。
sen.e: In the following year, he became the lecturer of Indian Philosophy in Tokyo Imperial University Literature University, and founded Toyo Girls' High School (present-day Toyo girls' senior high school) in 1905.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。定訳不明なため下記のとおり訳出しています。文科大学→Literature University 東洋高等女学校→Toyo Girls' High School
sen.e: In the following year, he became a lecturer of Indian Philosophy in Tokyo Imperial University Literature University, and founded Toyo Girls' High School (present-day Toyo girls' senior high school) in 1905.

In the following year, he became a lecturer of Indian Philosophy in Tokyo Imperial University Literature University, and founded Toyo Girls' High School (present-day Toyo girls' senior high school) in 1905.

sen.j: 1917年には、東京帝国大学印度哲学科の初代教授に就任した。
sen.e: In 1917, he assumed the post as the first professor of Philosophy Department, Tokyo Imperial University.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1917, he assumed the post as the first professor of the Philosophy Department, Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1917, he assumed the post as the first professor of the Philosophy Department, Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: 翌年、学士院会員となる。
sen.e: In the following year, he became a member of Academy.
In the following year, he became a member of the Academy.
In the following year, he became a member of the Academy.

sen.j: 1923年、東京帝国大学名誉教授。
sen.e: In 1923, he became the emeritus professor of Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1923, he became the emeritus professor of Tokyo Imperial University.
In 1923, he became the emeritus professor of Tokyo Imperial University.

sen.j: 1926年～1928年の間、大谷大学学長をつとめた。
sen.e: He served as the president of Otani University from 1926 to 1928.
He served as the president of Otani University from 1926 to 1928.
He served as the president of Otani University from 1926 to 1928.

sen.j: この間、1894年、鷲尾順敬・境野黄洋らと雑誌『仏教史林』を創刊し、1897年、『大日本仏教史』を刊行、1926年、 辻善之助らと『明治維新神仏分離史料』を編纂・刊行するなど、近代的な仏教史研究に大きく道を開いた。
sen.e: He contributed to the research of modern Buddhistic history; he launched the first issue of "Bukkyo Shirin" (Collection of Buddhistic history) magazine with Junkyo WASHIO and Koyo SAKAINO in 1894; he published "Dai Nihon Bukkyo shi"(History of Buddhistic in Great Japan) in 1897; he compiled and published "Meiji ishin shinbutsu bunri shiryo" (Historical materials on the separation of Shinto and Buddhism during the Meiji Restoration) with others including Zennosuke TSUJI in 1926.

He contributed to the research of modern Buddhist history; he launched the first issue of "Bukkyo Shirin" (Collection of Buddhist history) magazine with Junkyo WASHIO and Koyo SAKAINO in 1894; he published "Dai Nihon Bukkyo shi"(History of Buddhism in Great Japan) in 1897; he compiled and published "Meiji ishin shinbutsu bunri shiryo" (Historical materials on the separation of Shinto and Buddhism during the Meiji Restoration) with others including Zennosuke TSUJI in 1926.

He contributed to the research of modern Buddhist history; he launched the first issue of "Bukkyo Shirin" (Collection of Buddhist history) magazine with Junkyo WASHIO and Koyo SAKAINO in 1894; he published "Dai Nihon Bukkyo shi" (History of Buddhism in Great Japan) in 1897; he compiled and published "Meiji ishin shinbutsu bunri shiryo" (Historical materials on the separation of Shinto and Buddhism during the Meiji Restoration) with others including Zennosuke TSUJI in 1926.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: また、1901年、永年の仏教思想研究の成果に客観的方法論を導入して『仏教統一論』を著し、大乗非仏説を提起、大きな反響を呼んだ。
sen.e: In addition, he introduced objective methodology into the accomplishments of Buddhistic thought research to which he had been dedicated for a long time, and wrote "Bukkyo Toitsu Ron" (On the Unification of Buddhism) to advocate thesis that the Mahayana teachings do not stem from the historical Buddha, producing a lot of reactions.

In addition, he introduced an objective methodology into the accomplishments of Buddhist thought research to which he had been dedicated for a long time, and wrote "Bukkyo Toitsu Ron" (On the Unification of Buddhism) to advocate the thesis that the Mahayana teachings do not stem from the historical Buddha, which produced much controversy.

In 1901, he introduced an objective methodology into the accomplishments of Buddhist thought research to which he had been dedicated for a long time, and wrote "Bukkyo Toitsu Ron" (On the Unification of Buddhism) to advocate the thesis that the Mahayana teachings do not stem from the historical Buddha, which produced much controversy.

sen.j: このため一時、所属する真宗大谷派の僧籍を離れる（還俗）ことがあったが、同派出身の南条文雄・ 井上円了・ 清沢満之らをはじめ幅広い分野の人々と交流、終始一貫、近代的な仏教研究と教育体制の充実・整備に力を注いだ。
sen.e: That made him leave from priesthood of Shinshu sect Otani school he belonged to (exclaustration) for a while; he interacted with people from various fields including Bunyu NANJO from the same faction, Enryo INOUE, Manshi KIYOZAWA, and consistently strived to improve and maintain the research of modern Buddhism and educational system.

This resulted in him leaving the priesthood of Shinshu sect Otani school he belonged to (exclaustration) for a while; he interacted with people from various fields including Bunyu NANJO from the same faction, Enryo INOUE, Manshi KIYOZAWA, and consistently strived to improve and maintain the research of modern Buddhism and educational system.

This resulted in him leaving the priesthood of Shinshu sect Otani school he belonged to (exclaustration) for a while; he interacted with people from various fields including Bunyu NANJO from the same faction, Enryo INOUE, Manshi KIYOZAWA, and consistently strived to improve and maintain the research of modern Buddhism and educational system.

sen.j: 仏教三大宗摘要（1889年）
sen.e: Bukkyo Sandaishu Tekiyo: a summary of the three great Buddhist sects (in 1889)
Bukkyo Sandaishu Tekiyo: a summary of the three great Buddhist sects (in 1889)
Bukkyo Sandaishu Tekiyo: a summary of the three great Buddhist sects (in 1889)

sen.j: 因明学全書 活用講述（1891年）
sen.e: Inmyo-gaku zensho: Explanation of Inmyo, hetu-vidya Utilization guide (in 1889)
sen.cmt: 活用講述→utilization guideと訳出しています。
sen.e: Inmyo-gaku zensho: Explanation of Inmyo, hetu-vidya Utilization guide (in 1889)
Inmyo-gaku zensho: Explanation of Inmyo, hetu-vidya Utilization guide (in 1891)

sen.j: 日本仏教史綱（1898年）
sen.e: NIhon Bukkyoshi ko: Outline of the History of Japanese Buddhism (in 1898)
NIhon Bukkyoshi ko: Outline of the History of Japanese Buddhism (in 1898)
Nihon Bukkyoshi ko: Outline of the History of Japanese Buddhism (in 1898)
sen.cmt: Nihon大文字になっていたので訂正しました。

sen.j: 和漢仏教年契（1898年）
sen.e: Wakan Bukkyo Nenkei: chronological tables of Japanese and Chinese Buddhism (in 1898)
Wakan Bukkyo Nenkei: chronological tables of Japanese and Chinese Buddhism (in 1898)
Wakan Bukkyo Nenkei: chronological tables of Japanese and Chinese Buddhism (in 1898)

sen.j: 日本仏教一貫論（1890年）
sen.e: Nihon Bukkyo Ikkanron: the Coherent Principles of Japanese Buddhism (in 1890)
Nihon Bukkyo Ikkanron: the Coherent Principles of Japanese Buddhism (in 1890)
Nihon Bukkyo Ikkanron: the Coherent Principles of Japanese Buddhism (in 1890)

sen.j: 仏教統一論第1編：大綱論、第2編：原理論、第3編：仏陀論（1901～1905年）
sen.e: Bukkyo Toitsu Ron :On the Unification of Buddhism, the first edition: Outline, the second edition: Principle, the third edition: Budda (from 1901 to 1905)
Bukkyo Toitsu Ron :On the Unification of Buddhism, the first edition: Outline, the second edition: Principle, the third edition: Budda (from 1901 to 1905)
Bukkyo Toitsu Ron :On the Unification of Buddhism, the first edition: Outline, the second edition: Principle, the third edition: Budda (from 1901 to 1905)

sen.j: 大乗仏説論批判（1903年）
sen.e: Daijo bussetsuron hihan: criticism against the theory that Mahayana was expounded by the Buddha (in 1903)
Daijo bussetsuron hihan: criticism against the theory that Mahayana was expounded by the Buddha (in 1903)
Daijo bussetsuron hihan: criticism against the theory that Mahayana was expounded by the Buddha (in 1903)

sen.j: 最新学説女子教育論 女子教育管見（1905年）
sen.e: Saishin gakusetsu joshi kyoikuron: Arguments on Education for Women, on the newest theory, my view on the current girl education (in 1905)
sen.cmt: 女子教育管見→my view on the current girl education と訳出しました。
sen.e: Saishin gakusetsu joshi kyoikuron: Arguments on Education for Women, on the newest theory, my view on the current girl education (in 1905)
Saishin gakusetsu joshi kyoikuron: Arguments on Education for Women, on the newest theory, my view on the current girl education (in 1905)

sen.j: 真宗全史（1916年）
sen.e: Shinshu zenshi: The Complete History of the Shinshu Sect (in 1916)
Shinshu zenshi: The Complete History of the Shinshu Sect (in 1916)
Shinshu zenshi: The Complete History of the Shinshu Sect (in 1916)

sen.j: 親鸞の開宗（1921年）
sen.e: Shinran no kaishu: Shinran's establishment of the Jodo Shin shu, True Pure Land Sect (in 1921)
Shinran no kaishu: Shinran's establishment of the Jodo Shin shu, True Pure Land Sect (in 1921)

sen.e: Gakan Shinshu: my observation on the Shin-shu, True Pure Land sect (in 1921)

sen.e: Where does the seriousness of the Shin-shu (True Pure Land sect) exist? (in 1928)
